Convict.definition: to find guilty of a criminal offense [was ed of fraud] compare acquit [k√Ñ n-vikt] n
Convict.origin: [Latin convictus past participle of convincere to find guilty, prove, from com - with, together + vincer to conquer]

1.1: to find guilty of a criminal offense [was

2.1: a person convicted of and serving a sentence for a crime
